channel.title: Charlie sheen ain't got shit on this
channel.description:
I saw this on reddit the other day, and previously i've always hated and despised this guy.
All I can say is, watched this interview and new found respect and appreciation for this guy. He speaks at a million miles an hour with some profound and intelligent answers to the questions, and unlike Charlie Sheen he doesn't have to refer to "winning" all the time :P
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0qdNBrzAQjo&feature=player_embedded
He's so eccentric it seems as if he's coked up for the interview but I'm pretty sure he isn't.

I’ve always respected the guy, I really enjoyed ponderland where he talks absolute rubbish that is brilliant at the same time. His appearance has certainly improved since he’s started work in American

item.title: Charlie sheen ain't got shit on this
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

I often found Russel Brand amusing, but had a severe dislike for him otherwise and found him generally﻿ disagreeable. Until I saw this interview. Now I realise that the real Russel Brand is intelligent and thoughtful. Excellent and eye-opening interview.

That quote, taken from youtube, pretty much sums up what my feelings on him were before and after this video.

item.title: Charlie sheen ain't got shit on this
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

I haven’t read much about him, I’ve seen some of his ads and I saw him come on American Idol at my girlfriend’s house. I know he’s bipolar, I find the extreme difference between Sheen (possibly bipolar?) and his methodology in their respective interviews.

Read full topic

item.title: Charlie sheen ain't got shit on this
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

I’m just saying, when he was on Big Brothers Big Mouth that was his peak, he was on fire. Now he seems to have waves of genius every so often but these are merely ripples from his past success.

Read full topic
item.source: Charlie sheen ain't got shit on this

item.title: Charlie sheen ain't got shit on this
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

I love his ability to just talk. He speaks with such conviction and doesn’t seem like he needs to think about it or prepare what he is about to say. He just says it.

I’m not particularly a fan of his comedy, nor his stupid films, but when you get him in his interviews or on panel shows where they are typically unrehearsed, he comes out quite well.

Read full topic
item.source: Charlie sheen ain't got shit on this

item.source: Charlie sheen ain't got shit on this

item.title: Charlie sheen ain't got shit on this
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

I had a coterie of friends around me, including Amanda. I smoked abundant marijuana, smack and crack, and drank a skinful, as well as taking four tabs of Viagra, so I could still fuck. At one point, I mispronounced the name of a famous DJ (I think it was Danny Tenaglia, but I'm not sure even now) and fell off the stage. Boy George wrote in his Daily Express column that I had been brilliant and had done it all deliberately. The canyon between the perception of me and my actual reality seemed to be widening on a daily basis.

My hero <3

Heh.

What were these two going to talk about? It's the day after 9/11, and Kylie and Gritty are having a sort of awkward chat, with Gritty trying to be polite and Kylie asking, "What do you do?" sort of like the Queen would. And there's me standing beside them, still dressed as Osama bin Laden.

I thought: “It don’t get any better than this.”

And it didn’t, cos they sacked me about two days later.

OK I’m done

Read full topic
item.source: Charlie sheen ain't got shit on this

item.title: Charlie sheen ain't got shit on this
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Mopman:

Heh, have you read his autobiography? It’s actually pretty amusing

No, like I said, wasn’t a big fan… but now I’ll certainly consider reading it.

He’s still got a very egotistic personality, but he knows it and I love his comparisons of celebrities as the modern day “prophets” replacing the religious types that people previously idolised. His desire for fame and success is a result of society, and now as a celebrity he hates and despises it, very amusing.

Read full topic
